text:
I try to use the resolver to find some dtds using the following files:

./etc/xml/catalog.xml
./etc/xml/masterproperties-1_0.dtd
./etc/CatalogManager.properties

catalog.xml: 
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<!DOCTYPE catalog PUBLIC "-//OASIS/DTD Entity Resolution XML Catalog V1.0//EN"
                        
"http://www.oasis-open.org/committees/entity/release/1.0/catalog.dtd">
<catalog xmlns="urn:oasis:names:tc:entity:xmlns:xml:catalog">

    <system systemId="http://www.publity.de/xml/dtd/masterproperties-1_0.dtd"
            uri="masterproperties-1_0.dtd" />

    <public publicId="-//publity//DTD MasterProperties XML V1.0//EN"
            uri="masterproperties-1_0.dtd" />

</catalog>

CatalogManager.properties:
catalogs=xml/catalog.xml
relative-catalogs=false
static-catalog=yes
catalog-class-name=org.apache.xml.resolver.Resolver
verbosity=7


But I get the following output:
 [java] Parse catalog: file:/D:/devel/branch_3_10/ipo_src/etc/xml/catalog.xml
 [java] Loading catalog: file:/D:/devel/branch_3_10/ipo_src/etc/xml/catalog.xml
 [java] Default BASE: file:/D:/devel/branch_3_10/ipo_src/etc/xml/catalog.xml
 [java] java.net.SocketException: Connection reset by peer: connect
 [java]     at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method)
 ....

I think, I it would have found something, there would have been some messages
about the found mappings. But nothing. May be I am wrong, but I don't think so.
creator: obf@gmx.de

text:
I believe this bug is caused by the fact that the resolver attempts to load the
DTD of the catalog. I've just checked in some changes that I believe will fix this.

Catalogs now have a "bootstrapresolver" that uses files in the resolver.jar.
creator: apache-bugzilla@nwalsh.com
